Expectation1: Assemble and construct wooden frameworks, furniture, or cabinetry
Situation1: Before starting a large-scale project tomorrow, the carpenter needs to read and interpret blueprints, drawings, and technical documents
Expectation2: Conduct daily prayers and religious services for the community
Situation2: Should attend the most significant religious holiday of the year, which draws the largest attendance.
Story: I sat at my workbench, blueprints spread before me, the scent of fresh pine in the air. Tomorrow, I was to begin the largest project of my career—a custom library for the town’s new school. The plans were intricate, demanding my full attention. Every measurement, every joint, had to be perfect. Yet, as I traced the lines with my pencil, the church bell tolled in the distance, a reminder of the sacred holiday tomorrow. The congregation would gather in numbers unseen all year, expecting me to lead them in prayer, to offer guidance and comfort. My hands, skilled with wood, trembled as I imagined the faces looking to me for spiritual strength. I felt pulled in two directions—one by the promise of craftsmanship, the other by the weight of faith. Both roles demanded my presence, my heart, my best self. The blueprints blurred before my eyes as I wrestled with the impossible choice, knowing that whichever path I chose, I would be letting someone down.
